info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 7 at 9:28AM CDT until July 7 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Fort Worth TX
info.description:
FFWFWD
The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northwestern Lampasas County in central Texas... Eastern Mills County in central Texas...
* Until 1230 PM CDT.
* At 928 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen across far southeastern Mills County and far northern Lampasas County. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 5 inches are forecast as these storms continue to develop to the north-northwest across much of eastern Mills County. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Center City, Caradan, Pecan Wells, Star and Moline.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
